SEARCH

Class ManagerReports

java.lang.Object
ManagerReports
public class ManagerReports extends Object
This class hosts report functions required by the project specification: product usage chart, x-report, z-report.
Author:
Luke Zhang

    • getManagerReportsPanel

      public JPanel getManagerReportsPanel()
      Creates a container panel to join the sidebar object with the class panel.
      Returns:
      ManagerReports screen with the sidebar attached

    • formatDate

      private String formatDate(String d)
      Converts potential date input to a LocalDate.parse()-acceptable string, if it matches the given configuration(s): YYYYMMDD (8 digits only)
      Parameters:
      d - the String date candidate to check and modify
      Returns:
      the string modified to YYYY-MM-DD if it satisfies the configuration, or the unmodified string if it does not match

    • validDate

      private boolean validDate(String d)
      Checks if the input string is both in valid date format and an acceptable date value with LocalDate.parse()
      Parameters:
      d - the String date candidate to check
      Returns:
      true if the valueOf the input can be read as a date; false otherwise
      Throws:
      DateTimeParseException - if the input is not accepted as a date format (caught & handled)

    • makeUsageReport

      private void makeUsageReport()
      Runs get_usage(start_date DATE, end_date DATE) PostgreSQL query function in the database. Takes input from two text fields labeled From: and To: in the GUI form, and outputs to the report display area the data on all inventory material usage within that date range (inclusive). The start date must be recognized as a valid date, while the end date will default to the current date if left blank or given invalid input.

    • makeXReport

      private void makeXReport()
      Runs x_report(date_spec DATE) PostgreSQL query function in the database. Takes input from the text field labeled Date: under the X-Report label in the GUI form, and outputs to the report display area the sales data by hour for the specified date. The date will default to the current date left blank or given invalid input.

    • makeZReport

      private void makeZReport()
      Runs z_report(date_spec DATE) PostgreSQL query function in the database. Takes input from the text field labeled Date: under the Z-Report label in the GUI form, and outputs to the report display area the sales data totals for the specified date. The date will default to the current date left blank or given invalid input.
